RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui bacharelado em Matemtica (2009) e em Economia (2006), ambos pela Universidade Federal de Alagoas (UFAL). Possui mestrado em Matemtica pela UFAL (2011), doutorado em Matemtica pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) e pela Universit di Pisa (UNIPI-IT) (2015) em Teoria Ergdica e Sistemas Dinmicos. Tem tambm Ps Doutorado em Matemtica. Atualmente, professor Adjunto do Instituto de Matemtica da Universidade Federal de Alagoas. Professor Permanente do Programa de Ps Graduao do Instituto de Matemtica-PPGMAT onde realiza suas pesquisas em Teoria Ergdica que buscam compreender propriedades de longo prazo de sistemas que evoluem com o tempo. Atualmente, sou referee do journal Nonlinearity.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Matemtica Bacharelado from Universidade Federal de Alagoas (2010), graduation at Economia from Universidade Federal de Alagoas (2006), master's at Mathematics from Universidade Federal de Alagoas (2011), doctorate at Matemtica from Universit di Pisa (2015) and doctorate at Mathematics from Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2015). , acting on the following subjects: poincar, birkhoff and ergdico.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: Quantitative Statistical Stability for the Equilibrium States of Piecewise Partially Hyperbolic Maps
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO-INGLES: Quantitative Statistical Stability for the Equilibrium States of Piecewise Partially Hyperbolic Maps

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We consider a class of endomorphisms which contains a set of piecewise partially hyperbolic dynamics semi-conjugated to non-uniformly expanding maps. The aimed transformation preserves a foliation which is almost everywhere uniformly contracted with possible discontinuity sets, which are parallel to the contracting direction. We apply the spectral gap property and the ζ-Hlder regularity of the disintegration of its equilibrium state to prove a quantitative statistical stability statement. More precisely, under deterministic perturbations of the system of size δ, we show that the physical measure varies continuously with respect to a strong L∞-like norm. Moreover, we prove that its modulus of continuity is O(δζlogδ).
